questions.question: Acronym for Redundant Array of Independent Disks.
questions.explanation: RAID combines multiple disks for performance or redundancy.

questions.question: Acronym for Common Gateway Interface.
questions.explanation: CGI allows web servers to execute external programs.

questions.question: Acronym for Simple Mail Transfer Protocol.
questions.explanation: SMTP is used for sending email between servers.

questions.question: Acronym for Transmission Control Protocol.
questions.explanation: TCP ensures reliable data transmission over networks.

questions.question: Acronym for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol.
questions.explanation: DHCP automatically assigns IP addresses to network devices.

questions.question: Acronym for Extensible Markup Language.
questions.explanation: XML is used to store and transport structured data.

questions.question: Acronym for JavaScript Object Notation.
questions.explanation: JSON is a lightweight data interchange format.

questions.question: Acronym for Advanced Encryption Standard.
questions.explanation: AES is a widely used encryption algorithm.

questions.question: Acronym for Representational State Transfer.
questions.explanation: REST is an architectural style for designing web services.

questions.question: Acronym for Content Delivery Network.
questions.explanation: CDN distributes content across multiple servers for faster delivery.
